intro: Cymbachne, commonly known as the grass of the genus Cymbachne, is a group of flowering plants belonging to the grass family Poaceae. These plants are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in moist or wetland habitats. Cymbachne species are characterized by their slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. They produce small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the Poaceae family. Some species of Cymbachne are used in ecological restoration projects due to their ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion.
